revised_title: Contributions to Terrestrial Magnetism: No. IV
tldr: This paper discusses the author's continuation of Captain Sir Edward Belcher's magnetic observations, focusing on the temperature corrections for different types of needles and the magnetic force determined from the observed times of vibration. The paper also presents tables of results for the inclination of the needle, the declination and inclination of the needle, and the horizontal and total magnetic intensity at thirty-two stations.
